It may please yo

e 21 of Fe

of

: where

The next morning after he landed his men, and
endevored
e cutting of
e dicke towardes
Bridaw
and
e building of a fort, uppon
e point of the
said dicke: where he was shotte at, from the
towne, whens also there issued some fewe,
at
skirmished w
t
his people. But nothing of mo-
ment was perfourmed. The ennemie in those
quarters, is very strong: and will also make
offers to buy
e towne: as he doth understand, but
report, promising threescore moneths pay to
every souldier. Whiche, for mine owne part, con-
sidering what I heare of
e desperat disposition,
and courses over dissolut of those soulders, I
dout, if they can, they will rather accept, then
yeld obedience to
e states. I have talked w
th
a couple,
at are come from
e towne, since the
states arrivall, who left them then at a resolut
point, if
e siege continued, to putte out all
e
Burgers, for their better provision,
or if all sholde faile
ether to call in
e ennemie, or to fight it out to
e uttermost
Manytimes, since my imploiment in this service,
I have offered publickly at
e Councell table, and
privatly to
Barnevelt
